https://prez.dev/description.@value: A categorization of disciplines or topics that the broad field of Earth science can be subdivided into, i.e. a listing of the Fields of Research, or subjects, to which a geoscience dataset, publication, observation/activity, or entity pertains. The vocabulary also contains relevant disciplines that intersect with the various Earth science fields, such as biological sciences and built environment and design, as well as entries related to collection and heritage management. Notations included are those from the 2020 ANZSRC listing (see History Note) or in common use in the geoscience community.

http://www.w3.org/2004/02/skos/core#defi.@value: Geophysical methods that involve the use of electrical and electromagnetic fields to study the subsurface properties of the Earth. These methods exploit the interaction between electromagnetic waves and the electrical conductivity, permittivity, and magnetic susceptibility of subsurface materials.

http://www.w3.org/2004/02/skos/core#pref.@value: electrical and electromagnetic methods in geophysics

https://prez.dev/label.@value: electrical and electromagnetic methods in geophysics

https://prez.dev/description.@value: Geophysical methods that involve the use of electrical and electromagnetic fields to study the subsurface properties of the Earth. These methods exploit the interaction between electromagnetic waves and the electrical conductivity, permittivity, and magnetic susceptibility of subsurface materials.

The use of geophysical methods to detect and image different electrical properties of the subsurface, by measuring naturally occurring (i.e. passive) or artificially introduced (i.e. active) voltage potentials, electrical currents, and/or electromagnetic fields. Subsurface electrical properties can be measured galvanically via direct electrode connection to the ground or inductively via electromagnetic field induction through the subsurface. The Electrical resistivity technique is used to determine the resistivity of subsurface materials, the Induced Polarization (IP) technique is used to measure the decay of voltage in the ground, and the Self-Potential (SP) technique looks for natural voltage sources underground.

The use of geophysical methods to detect and image the electrical properties of the subsurface by inducing electromagnetic (EM) energy within the subsurface (i.e. propagation of electromagnetic fields composed of an alternating electric intensity and magnetizing force) and measuring the response of earth materials.

Magnetotellurics (MT) is a passive geophysical method used to infer the Earth's subsurface electrical resistivity/conductivity from measurements of natural variations of geomagnetic and geoelectric field at the Earth's surface, i.e. the use of natural electromagnetic signals to image subsurface electrical conductivity structure through electromagnetic induction.
